question: Alex is rolling a 10-sided die. How much more likely is it (expressed as a percentage) that he rolls a number greater than 5 than that he rolls two even numbers in a row?
answer:
There are 5 numbers greater than 5 on the dice, so the chances of rolling one of them are 5/10=50%.
The chance of rolling one even number is 50%, so the chance of rolling two in a row is 50% * 50% = 25%.
The difference between these two probabilities is 50% - 25% = 25%.
#### 25
